subject: Junit with eclipse 2.0 and running plugin tests
msgSnippet: Hey all, First off, if this is the wrong place to ask this, could you point me to the right place? I am just starting up trying to get some junit tests put
messageBody:
Hey all,
First off, if this is the wrong place to ask this, could you point
me to the right place?

I am just starting up trying to get some junit tests put together
for a collection of Eclipse plugins targeting Eclipse 2.0. Following
along at:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/jdt-ui-
home/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.junit/index.html
it looked like I should just have to download and install the
org.eclipse.pde.junit plugin and I should be able to run plugin tests.

After installing that, the Run As->Junit Workbench is not available.
There is a Run As -> Junit Plugin Test, but when ever I point that at
my test cases it seems to work for a few seconds then nothing
happens. If I look at the debug perspective I do see a new terminated
Javaw.exe, so it looks like it tried to do something, but I have
nothing on the console, and the Junit view is blank other then under
Failure Trace which says "Launching TestRunner". There does not seem
to be anything in the .log file either.

As a note, if I select the project that contains all the tests, and
do a Run As-> Junit Plugin Test, it will find my test cases, but when
I select the test I want to run, it does the same as above. If I
just do a Run as -> Junit Test, then I can at least run simple tests.

Any ideas as to what I may be doing wrong? Any information I missed
posting that may help solve this?

Thanks,
-Peter
